newsitem.title: FRANCE: Thomson-CSF slips, market eyes sale terms.
newsitem.headline: Thomson-CSF slips, market eyes sale terms.

text.p: Shares in French defence electronics firm Thomson-CSF eased 0.62 percent to 191.80 francs at 0932 GMT, after the group posted a return to profit with a 1996 net attributable gain of 745 million francs.

"The operating profit is in line with expectations," said a dealer. Net attributable profit was lower than the some one billion francs some had been expecting because the company had loaded the accounts with restructuring charges, which was viewed as a "good thing", he added.
But the market was not looking so much at the 1996 results as the prospects for Thomson's acquisition, he said.
The market was down 0.55 percent at 0956 GMT. Market operators want to know whether Alcatel Alsthom or Lagardere Groupe will win the bidding for Thomson-CSF.
The rival bidders are expected to pay a premium to gain control of Thomson-CSF, which will please minority shareholders, traders said.
French newspapers have reported the terms and conditions of the Thomson-CSF sale are expected to be sent to the Privatisation Commission later this week or early next week.
Thomson-CSF is holding an analysts meeting this afternoon from 1400 GMT.
